result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrius K. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1050, 15TR5345/15TR5345 called: 2:55pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CF1050 - Ct. 1 (Poss w/Intent - THC<=200g)>>AMEND to Poss THC/2nd+ Offense pursuant to 961.41 (3g)(e)
15TR5345>>DISMISS
15TR5346>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF1050 - Ct. 1 (Poss THC/2nd+ Offense)>>NO CONTEST
15CF1050 - Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd w/child passenger)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on Ct. 1 ONLY; 2 years probation.
CONDITIONS:  Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO including AODA and any follow up; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; Absolute sobriety; CC ordered but REMITTED; DNA sample and surcharge; 

Ct. 2>>10 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 4 days of time already served, concurrent to any other sentence; $1904 inclusive; 6 month DL Rev w/credit;  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 26 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies.

>>Probation/jail time may be served/transferred to Langlade County.
